Title: The Library at Mount Char
Review:
the library at mount char is a unique story premise told in an incredibly unique way. i loved the vibrant characters, the black humour, and the theatrically gruesome violence underpinned by an overall sardonic tone. the break-neck speed of the story had me completely hooked.

however... i didnt love some of the tropes that scott hawkins' character arcs fell into. particularly i felt that including r*pes as part of carolyn's vengeful motivations felt reductive (can't have a female fantasy protag without a traumatic r*pe backstory!)

there were a couple other things but... overall this was a fucked up and unique and exhilarating read!

Title: Daughter of the Forest
Review:
TW: rape

 this book is like fair folk of sevenwaters: i was drawn in and eventually captured by the gorgeous forest with its ancient mysticism & beauty, by sorcha's selfless love and strength. but at the end when i was spit out of this world, i was left reeling and confused.
 
(also i really cant not take of the criticism glasses and have to mention that a large chunk of sorcha's story is propelled by a violent rape & the love story revolves around a man in his 20s while she is 14/15)
